title: Packet loss. I tried the fixes I found on the troubleshooting. reinstalled the game. nothing works
body: anyone has an idea to what works.

replies.body:
So I have been having more packet loss to riot in the last month or so (started around when WW hit the PBE)
In game I see a lot of players complain about high pings or lag too.

I ping google.com and get no packet loss and low pings.

So why is it with Riot severs only?

FYI other online games are not seeing this for me.

> [{quoted}](name=LordTulkus,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=VYiAEZ9E,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-01-30T23:25:39.523+0000)
>
> So I have been having more packet loss to riot in the last month or so (started around when WW hit the PBE)
> In game I see a lot of players complain about high pings or lag too.
> 
> I ping google.com and get no packet loss and low pings.
> 
> So why is it with Riot severs only?
> 
> FYI other online games are not seeing this for me.

am literally just reinstalling everything. my drivers atm. everything. if this doesn't fix it only riot is left. because a lot of people are complaining especially lately.

Packet Loss typically occurs if there are problems along your network routing to our servers. We can look into your route if you complete a traceroute log using [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/). After booting up the app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After the trace has run for 5+ minutes, you can export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you run into any issues.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=VYiAEZ9E,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-29T22:15:00.180+0000)
>
> Packet Loss typically occurs if there are problems along your network routing to our servers. We can look into your route if you complete a traceroute log using [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/). After booting up the app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After the trace has run for 5+ minutes, you can export the results as text and paste them in a reply.
> 
> Let me know if you run into any issues.

It doesn't look like your trace captured a lot of packet loss, but did capture some fairly bad latency inside your network as well as along your entire route to our servers. Reaching out to your ISP's tier 2 support with this traceroute should be enough to launch an investigation from their end.

If you have any other questions, let me know.

hello?
not great at this stuff but 100% packet loss from one of the hosts isn't good.
